citation.article-title: A phylogenetic analysis of an atypical leuconostoc: description of Leuconostoc fallax sp. nov.

p.s: Description of Leuconostoc fallax sp. nov.
Leuconostoc fallax (fal'lax. L. adj. fallax deceptive)
Large spheres or lenticular cells (1.0-1.2 × 2.0-2.4 μm) in pairs or short chains.
Grows at 10° and 40°C, but not at 45 °C.
Acid is produced from N-acetylglucosamine, D-fructose, D-glucose, D-mannose, amethyl-D-glucoside, maltose, ribose, sucrose and D-turanose.
A delayed acid reaction may also be produced from mannitol and trehalose.

Acid is not produced from adonitol, arabinose, arabitol, arbutin, amygdalin, cellobiose, dulcitol, fucose, galactose, glycerol, lactose, melibiose, melezitose, D-raffinose, rhamnose, salicin, sorbitol, L-sorbose, D-tagatose and xylose.
Does not produce ammonia from arginine.
The G + C content of DNA is 40% (Tm).
